Which of the following statement is correct in relation to the hydrogen atom?
(a) 3s-orbital is lower in energy than \(3 p-\) orbital.
(b) 3p - orbital is lower in energy than \(3 \mathrm{d}-\) orbital.
(c) \(3 \mathrm{s}\) and \(3 \mathrm{p}\) -orbitals are of lower energy than \(3 \mathrm{d}\) -orbitals.
(d) \(3 \mathrm{s}, 3 \mathrm{p}\) and \(3 \mathrm{d}\) -orbitals all have same energy.
